title: 'Tufat al-Muminat': JeM launches online 'jihadi course' for women; will charge PKR 500
content: Pakistan-based Jaish-e-Mohammed has launched an online training course, 'Tufat al-Muminat,' led by Masood Azhar's sister, to recruit women and raise funds. This initiative, following the formation of its women's wing, signals a strategic shift, potentially involving female suicide attackers. The group continues to operate and solicit donations openly, despite international scrutiny.

title: IPL trade: Ishan Kishan returning home? Lot of interest for wicketkeeper-batter
content: Ishan Kishan is attracting interest from multiple IPL franchises ahead of the mini-auction, with Mumbai Indians leading the chase to bring the wicketkeeper-batter back. Despite a mixed spell at SRH, Kishan‚Äôs strong Ranji form and past success with MI make him a valuable top-order option. Talks hinge on SRH‚Äôs willingness and Kishan‚Äôs own decision to move.

title: Eknath Chitnis passes away: Isro pioneer was 100; built India‚Äôs first telecom satellite
content: Isro scientist Dr Eknath Chitnis has passed away at the age of 100. He was a foundational figure at the Indian Space Research Organisation. Dr Chitnis worked with Dr Homi Bhabha in the early days. He was instrumental in developing India's first telecommunication satellite, INSAT. This satellite advanced the nation's space communication capabilities.

title: Satya Nadella's pay package rises to a record $96.5 million
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has secured a record-breaking $96.5 million compensation package for fiscal year 2025, a significant 22% increase. This substantial reward is attributed to his strategic leadership in artificial intelligence, a sector where Microsoft is making significant strides. The company's impressive financial performance, with revenue soaring to $281.7 billion, is directly linked to AI investments in products like Azure and Copilot.

title: Watch: Neeraj Chopra conferred honorary rank of Lt Colonel in Army
content: Olympic champion Neeraj Chopra has been appointed Lieutenant Colonel (Honorary) in the Indian Army. This honour follows his distinguished military career and numerous athletic achievements. Chopra's journey includes significant awards like the Arjuna Award, Khel Ratna, and Padma Shri. His recent participation in the World Athletics Championships also saw him compete strongly.

title: Louvre heist: Museum reopens 3 days after jewellery heist
content: The Louvre reopened after a three-day closure due to the theft of royal jewels. The Apollo Gallery remains shut following a daylight heist where thieves used an extendable ladder and power tools to steal eight priceless pieces. The incident highlights ongoing security upgrade delays and concerns about the museum's obsolescence.

title: Apple MacBook Pro with M5 chip goes on sale today: 8 things not to miss before buying
content: Apple's new MacBook Pro, powered by the M5 chip, has launched in India starting at Rs 1,69,900. It boasts up to 3.5x faster AI performance, enhanced graphics, and an impressive 24-hour battery life.

title: Why global apps showed Delhi‚Äôs AQI levels at 2,000+, but CPCB under 400
content: Delhi residents were confused by vastly different pollution readings on Tuesday. While India's CPCB showed AQI below 400, international apps like IQAir reported over 2,000. Experts explain these discrepancies stem from different calculation methods and data sources, though both indicate dangerously poor air quality post-Diwali.

title: Kiran Mazumdar offers money to fix Bengaluru roads; Chidambaram says problem is execution
content: Biocon chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has offered to fund repairs for Bengaluru's damaged roads, prompting a proposal from P Chidambaram for industry to supervise public works. This initiative aims to improve project execution and accountability, addressing the city's persistent infrastructure issues amid public frustration.

title: 'I have been critical of Modi because ... ' : Zohran Mamdani attends Diwali event in New York
content: New York State Assembly member Zohran Mamdani has drawn controversy for criticizing Prime Minister Narendra Modi's vision of India, stating it lacks room for all citizens. Mamdani, running for New York City mayor, emphasizes his campaign's commitment to pluralism and representing all New Yorkers, regardless of their views on Modi.

title: ChatGPT gets browser: Google loses $150B; Chrome faces monopoly threat
content: OpenAI's new AI browser, ChatGPT Atlas, has shaken the tech world.  The launch caused a massive $150 billion drop in Alphabet's market value.  CEO Sam Altman called it a rare chance to redefine web browsing.  Atlas integrates ChatGPT directly, allowing AI to perform tasks.  This poses a significant challenge to Google's search advertising revenue.  Investors are watching closely as Google also integrates AI into its Chrome browser.  The competition for browser dominance is heating up.

title: Gold and silver rate outlook: Where are prices headed after Diwali rally fizzles?
content: Gold and silver prices are experiencing a temporary correction after a significant rally, with experts predicting a strong long-term outlook. Despite recent dips, global demand, central bank buying, and geopolitical factors are expected to support further price increases for gold. Silver also saw a substantial rise and may consolidate before resuming an upward trend.

title: 'Want to be nice to China': Trump amid 155% glooming tariffs
content: President Trump expressed a desire for amicable relations with China but criticized the nation's past trade practices, attributing them to a lack of business acumen in previous US leadership. He highlighted significant tariff revenues, suggesting potential distributions to citizens. Trump also indicated India has reduced Russian oil purchases, aligning with his desire for peace in Ukraine. A potential trade deal with China is anticipated at the upcoming APEC summit.

title: Trump pressured Zelenskyy to give up eastern Donbas in 'tense' meeting
content: A senior Ukrainian official revealed that President Trump urged President Zelenskyy to cede the Donbas region to Russia for peace during a tense meeting. Trump reportedly echoed Putin's talking points, warning Zelenskyy of annihilation if a deal wasn't struck. Zelenskyy left the White House without securing commitments, facing pressure for territorial concessions.

title: Lucknow: Elderly Dalit man forced to lick ground after 'accidentally unrinating' near temple
content: An elderly Dalit man was allegedly forced to lick the ground near a Lucknow temple on Diwali after being accused of urinating there. The victim's family states it was an accident due to his breathing difficulties. Police have arrested the accused, Swami Kant, and are investigating the incident, which has sparked political outrage.

title: 'I got very angry': Trump reacts to being rated third-best US President
content: President Donald Trump expressed significant anger after being ranked third on a "Presidential Walk of Fame," placing him behind George Washington and Abraham Lincoln.  He lamented the ranking, stating it was "less than great." Trump acknowledged the difficulty of surpassing the historical figures but vowed to try, humorously noting his administration's involvement in numerous wars.

title: New twist to Asia Cup trophy row: Naqvi sends message to BCCI
content: A dispute has erupted between the BCCI and PCB over the Asia Cup trophy presentation. PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi insists on personally handing the trophy to India in Dubai on November 10, following India's refusal to accept it from him after their win. This stems from tensions between the Indian team and the ACC president.

title: 'Vile degradation': Trump ally shocked to discover MAGA's anti-India rhetoric
content: For once, D‚ÄôSouza didn‚Äôt hit back. He seemed shaken. ‚ÄúIn a career spanning forty years,‚Äù he wrote later, ‚ÄúI have never encountered this type of rhetoric. The Right never used to talk like this. So who on our side has legitimised this type of vile degradation?‚Äù

title: 'Activate your embassy in Kabul': Taliban urges US to reopen mission; seeks trade, ties
content: The Taliban's interim government in Afghanistan has expressed a desire for good economic and political ties with the US, urging Washington to reopen its embassy in Kabul instead of focusing on Bagram Airbase. This comes as India has upgraded its technical mission in Kabul to a full embassy, signaling strengthened bilateral engagement.

title: Hardik Pandya comeback: Cricketer to spend four weeks at BCCI's CoE
content: Hardik Pandya is undergoing a four-week rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru for his quadriceps injury, with no surgery required. He is expected to be fit for the upcoming white-ball series against South Africa, aiming for complete match fitness after picking up the injury during the Asia Cup.

title: Popular Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon shot at in Canada: Bullets pumped into stomach
content: Punjabi singer Teji Kahlon was shot in Canada by associates of gangster Rohit Godara, who claimed Kahlon supplied weapons and money to rival gangs and acted as an informant. This incident highlights an ongoing transnational gang feud, following the recent murder of businessman Ramesh Rulania in Rajasthan, also suspected to be linked to Godara's gang.

title: Delhi air pollution: Worst Diwali air in 4 years, Tuesday winds prevent ‚Äòsevere‚Äô drop
content: Delhi's air quality plunged into the 'very poor' category on Diwali night as firecracker violations surged, pushing PM2.5 levels to their highest since 2021. Despite a temporary spike, rising winds and warmer temperatures prevented a prolonged severe episode. Authorities are monitoring the situation, with Stage III of GRAP not yet invoked.

title: Air India Newark flight makes emergency return to Mumbai; technical issue suspected
content: An Air India flight from Mumbai to Newark made a safe return to Mumbai due to a suspected technical problem. This incident caused the cancellation of both the outbound and inbound flights. Air India is assisting affected passengers with hotel stays and rebooking them on alternative flights to ensure they reach their destinations.

title: Who is Francesca Orsini, JNU and London University scholar denied entry at Delhi airport?
content: Professor Francesca Orsini, a UK-based scholar of Hindi and Urdu literature at SOAS, University of London, was recently deported from Delhi‚Äôs Indira Gandhi International Airport over alleged visa violations. Holding a PhD from SOAS and a BA in Hindi from Venice University, Orsini has studied in India and taught at Cambridge. A Fellow of the British Academy, she specialises in multilingual literary cultures of South Asia and has authored several acclaimed academic works.

title: Chopper scare: President Murmu‚Äôs helicopter wheels sink into landing pad in Kerala
content: During her visit to Kerala, President Droupadi Murmu encountered a small mishap as her helicopter touched down on a helipad that unexpectedly sank. However, swift measures from the authorities ensured her well-being. Over the next four days, her agenda features a prominent pilgrimage to the revered Sabarimala temple, alongside several inaugural ceremonies and centenary festivities throughout the region.

title: Liver damage warning signs visible on your hands; here‚Äôs what you need to know
content: Your hands can offer early warnings of liver trouble. Look for red palms, changes in nails like brittleness or white tips, and persistent itching. These subtle signs, including tremors and bent fingers, may point to conditions like fatty liver or cirrhosis. Prompt medical attention for these hand symptoms is crucial for effective management and preventing serious liver disease.

title: Fortnite v37.51 Update: Downtime schedule and start time by region
content: Fortnite is undergoing routine server maintenance starting at 4 AM ET, with downtime expected to last a few hours. This update will introduce new content, including cosmetics and potential gameplay adjustments, to keep the game fresh. Players are advised to complete in-game tasks beforehand and monitor official channels for updates.

title: WH diwali party: Trump mispronounces names of Indian-Americans leaders - watch
content: During a White House Diwali celebration, President Trump's attempts to greet Indian-American leaders and dignitaries were marked by several mispronunciations of their names. This follows a pattern of the former president struggling with names and words, both domestically and internationally, often leading to public amusement.

title: Gold rate today: Yellow metal rebounds, global prices at $4,146
content: Gold prices saw a slight increase on Wednesday. This followed a significant drop the previous day. Investors are now keenly observing US inflation figures. These numbers will offer clues about the Federal Reserve's future interest rate decisions. The market is anticipating potential buying opportunities after the recent price decline.

title: 'Don't want to intervene...': India batting coach on RoKo; talks about their form
content: India's batting coach Sitanshu Kotak backed senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli after their struggles in the first ODI against Australia. Kotak cited their IPL experience and strong preparation, dismissing concerns about rustiness. He also highlighted the impact of rain interruptions on the team's batting performance.

title: 'Pehle bhot bura haal tha': Nitish says he is back with NDA 'for good'
content: Bihar chief minister Nitish Kumar declared his return to the NDA "for good," citing "circumstances" as the reason for past alliances with the RJD. He criticized the RJD's previous rule, highlighting improvements in infrastructure, education, healthcare, and law and order under his leadership, while emphasizing his government's focus on women's empowerment.

title: Former Fiji rugby captain 'Big Joe' Veitayaki dies at 58
content: Former Fiji rugby captain Joeli Veitayaki, aged 58, has passed away unexpectedly. Known as Big Joe, he earned 49 caps for Fiji between 1994 and 2003, playing at the 1999 and 2003 Rugby World Cups. Veitayaki also played for the Chiefs, Blues, Northland, and Ulster, leaving a lasting legacy both on and off the field. Tributes highlight his strength, humility, and mentorship, and his son Haereiti Hetet continues the family‚Äôs rugby tradition.

title: Why no Sarfaraz in India A squad? 100-plus avg in first-class but ignored
content: Mumbai cricketers Sarfaraz Khan and Ayush Mhatre faced contrasting fortunes as India A squads were announced. Sarfaraz Khan was surprisingly ignored despite a strong domestic record, while 18-year-old Ayush Mhatre earned a fast-track call-up despite an ordinary recent tour.

title: Tamil Nadu rains: Chennai on orange alert, schools shut; cyclone expected
content: A low-pressure area over the Bay of Bengal has intensified, bringing rain to coastal districts including Chennai. The India Meteorological Department has issued red and orange alerts for extremely heavy to very heavy rainfall in several north and delta districts on Wednesday and Thursday. The system may strengthen into a depression, with a possibility of developing into a cyclone.

title: Adelaide ODI shock: Virat Kohli safe, but Rohit Sharma in big trouble
content: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma aim for a strong comeback in the second ODI against Australia at Adelaide after a disappointing return in Perth. Kohli boasts an impressive record at Adelaide Oval, while Rohit seeks to improve his modest statistics. Experts believe the duo will find their rhythm and contribute significantly to India's batting success.

title: Trump says he spoke to PM Modi about avoiding war with Pak; dials down Russian oil claims
content: US President Donald Trump announced that Prime Minister Narendra Modi has assured him India will significantly reduce its oil purchases from Russia. Trump mentioned this during a White House Diwali event. He also indicated that both leaders are working on trade deals. A potential meeting between Trump and Modi is being considered for the upcoming ASEAN summit.

title: ‚ÄòLaughter Chefs‚Äô returns: Bharti Singh and Chef Harpal Singh Sokhi to make comeback
content: Get ready for more culinary chaos and comedy! Laughter Chefs is returning for its third season, promising double the fun with beloved host Bharti Singh and celebrity chef Harpal Singh Sokhi. Expect fresh faces, hilarious challenges, and the signature wit that made the show a hit.

title: Watch: Israeli settlers attack Palestinian farmers in West Bank
content: A Palestinian woman suffered a head injury after a masked Jewish settler attacked her during olive picking. The unprovoked assault in Turmus Ayya was captured on video. The incident is part of escalating settler violence against Palestinian farmers. The UN reports a significant rise in such attacks, with many olive trees damaged.

title: Midnight rescue: Mumbai Police saves newborn abandoned in Goregaon
content: Mumbai Police officers from Bangur Nagar Police Station rescued a newborn baby abandoned between two parked vans in Goregaon. Beat Marshals discovered the infant around midnight and immediately alerted the Nirbhaya Squad. The baby was rushed to Shatabdi Hospital, declared stable, and subsequently handed over to St. Catherine‚Äôs Home for care.

title: Women's World Cup: How can India qualify for semis? Scenarios explained
content: Australia, England, and South Africa have secured semi-final berths in the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup. India, New Zealand, and Sri Lanka are vying for the final spot, with an India-New Zealand clash proving pivotal. A look at the scenarios for the remaining place in the Women's world Cup semi-final.

title: This is how FMCG firms will pass GST 2.0 benefits‚ÄîIt's not cutting prices!
content: Get ready for bigger biscuits and bottles! FMCG companies are bringing back popular price points like Rs 5 and Rs 20 by mid-November. Following GST rate cuts, companies will now offer increased product quantities instead of lower prices, ensuring a win-win for consumers and retailers. This move aims to simplify transactions and restore consumer satisfaction.

title: MP horror: Refused to drive vehicle, Dalit man ‚Äòforced to drink urine‚Äô in Bhind
content: In a disturbing incident in Bhind district, authorities have detained three suspects accused of kidnapping and violently attacking a Dalit driver hailing from Gwalior. The individual revealed harrowing details of physical abuse, being coerced to consume alcohol, and even being forced to ingest urine before being left deserted.

title: Delhi horror: Boy, 5, kidnapped, bludgeoned and stabbed by father‚Äôs driver
content: A five-year-old boy was allegedly kidnapped, brutally murdered with bricks and a knife in Narela. Police suspect the boy's father's driver, Neetu, committed the crime to exact revenge after being reprimanded for an altercation. Neetu is currently absconding, and police are actively searching for him.

title: SGA's winning FTs put bow on 35-point ring night
content: On a night the Thunder received their championship rings, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander finished in style by hitting two free throws to lift OKC to a 125-124 double-overtime win over the Rockets.

title: QB Wilson calls out ex-coach Payton as 'classless'
content: Russell Wilson called out Sean Payton on social media after his former coach said after Sunday's game that he told Giants owner John Mara that he wished the team had waited to change quarterbacks until after they played the Broncos.

title: Stable Butler, 'matured' Kuminga lift Warriors
content: Jimmy Butler, with a focus on getting to the line and making free throws, and Jonathan Kuminga, with an offseason contract standoff behind him, helped lead the Warriors to a season-opening win over the Lakers.

title: Durant pins 2OT loss on himself in Rockets debut
content: In his debut with Houston on Tuesday, Kevin Durant blamed himself for the Rockets' 125-124, double-overtime loss to the defending champion Oklahoma City Thunder at Paycom Center, telling reporters that he made "two plays" that were "the reason we lost."

title: Trout: Was alerted to Kay's possible drug abuse
content: Mike Trout testified that he was alerted by a team employee to possible concerns about drug abuse by convicted ex-Angels communication director Eric Kay.

title: Marchand emotional in 'touching' return to Boston
content: Brad Marchand appeared to be holding back tears on the ice when the TD Garden crowd gave him a standing ovation Tuesday night during his first game as a Bruins opponent.

title: Izzo blasts NCAA for 'ridiculous' G League ruling
content: In the wake of two former G League players committing to play for Division I schools, Michigan State coach Tom Izzo sounded off Tuesday on the NCAA powerbrokers who've allowed those moves to happen.

title: Raiders' Meyers 'for sure' still wants to be traded
content: Raiders wide receiver Jakobi Meyers is standing firm with his request to be traded from the team with the NFL's Nov. 4 trade deadline approaching.

content: Atlas is a web browser with ChatGPT embedded throughout, allowing users to interact with the AI assistant directly on any webpage.

title: Chhath Puja To Be Performed At 1,500 Ghats Across Delhi
content: The Delhi BJP on Wednesday said this year's Chhath Puja celebrations will be organised at around 1,500 ghats across the city.

title: Karnataka Congress MLA Flags 900 Crore Fund Crunch In Free Bus Travel Scheme
content: According to the Congress leader, the corporation is struggling to break even and urged the government to release the pending funds.

title: Congress Leader's "Surname" Charge Over Sarfaraz Khan Snub And A Gambhir Dig
content: Congress leader Shama Mohamed has alleged religious bias in the selection process of the Indian cricket team after middle-order batter Sarfaraz Khan was left out of the recently announced squads.

title: Japan's New PM To Woo Trump With Pickups And Soybeans
content: As Japan's new premier Sanae Takaichi got to work on Wednesday, her government began finalising a purchase package, including US pickups, soybeans and gas, to present to President Donald Trump in trade and security talks next week, two sources said.

title: Explained: 350 vs 1,100, CPCB vs IQAir, Who Has Got Delhi's AQI Right
content: Both CPCB and IQAir follow different methods of calculating air quality index, resulting in different numbers.

title: Sri Lankan Politician Assassinated In Office, Gunman Fired Multiple Shots
content: Lasantha Wickramasekara, 38, the council chairman of the coastal city of Weligama, was meeting with constituents when a gunman burst in and fired multiple times with a revolver.

title: Video: BMW Crashes Inside Mumbai's Coastal Road Tunnel, Traffic Affected
content: A speeding BMW car overturned inside a tunnel of Mumbai's Coastal Road, slowing down traffic for a while, officials said on Wednesday.

title: Punjab Saw Dip In Farm Fires Incident From September 15-October 21: Data
content: Punjab recorded 415 farm fire incidents between September 15 and October 21 this year, down from 1,510 incidents during the same period last year, data showed.

title: 'Stealth Husband' Of Japan's New PM Sanae Takaichi Vows Quiet Support
content: The spouse of Japan's first woman Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi hopes to support her by being a "stealth husband", cooking meals but staying out of the spotlight.

title: Tamil Nadu Man Kills Wife, Stuffs Body In Drum And Buries It, Arrested
content: Thirty-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering his wife, whose body was found stuffed in a drum and buried near a burial ground in neighbouring Tiruvallur district, police said on Wednesday.

title: Yogi Adityanath Flags "Political Islam", Adds A Halal Certification Warning
content: Stressing that "political Islam" is a major threat that aims to change India's "demography", Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said our ancestors fought against this threat, but it is hardly discussed now

title: Rohit Godara Gang Member Tries To Escape Rajasthan Cops Disguised As Woman, Arrested
content: The police said they received intelligence that Abhishek, also known as Batar, had changed his appearance and was in Kotputli-Behror to commit a crime.

title: UP Man Makes Pet Dog Attack Child After Guava Falls In His Courtyard
content: Grabbed by the hair, beaten up and then bitten by a pet dog - this was a child's ordeal in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur when a guava he tossed landed in his neighbour's house.

title: The Reality Of Japanese Politics For Women In A Male-Dominated Society
content: The three local councillors anticipate Sanae Takaichi's win will do little to shift the male-dominated world of politics or entrenched expectations that women will prioritise family over career.

title: Louvre Museum Reopens 3 Days After Over $100 Million Jewel Heist
content: The Louvre reopened its doors to visitors on Wednesday, three days after it had been shuttered over the theft of precious royal jewellery, a journalist saw.

title: How Rise Of China 'Hawk' Sanae Takaichi Could Impact Japan-India Ties
content: Hardline conservative Sanae Takaichi has been elected Japan's first female prime minister after a whirlwind few weeks of political wrangling.

title: P Chidambaram Says Problem With Fixing Roads Is Not Funds, But Execution
content: Congress MP P Chidambaram has claimed that Biocon chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has offered to fund the repair work of roads in Bengaluru. He welcomed the offer but said that lack of funds isn't the problem, but execution of public work is.

title: NHL rink report: Matthew Schaefer's hot start, Tusky's debut, games of the week
content: no. 1 draft pick has had quite the debut in the NHL, hasn't he? he started his NHL career with a five-game point streak (and counting) that's the second-longest point streak by any defenseman from the start of their career .

title: 'Sarfaraz not selected because of surname': Congress leader targets Gambhir
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 8
content: a team with Would be in status is featured in this week's top-12 projection . teams with Work to do are the true bubble teams and the first ones outside the bracket . one team with work to do is passing the eye test and has a chance at winning its conference .

title: MMA divisional rankings: How did Brendan Allen upsetting Reinier de Ridder shake things up?
content: reinier de Ridder is now ahead of the top-ranked middleweight . he's the only other weight class with changes in these rankings is heavyweight, because Francis Ngannou has not fought in just over a year and was removed as ineligible .

title: Star javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra conferred rank of Lieutenant Colonel
content: Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra was honoured with the rank of Lieutenant Colonel recognising his contributions to sports and national pride

title: Opposition raises spectre of corruption against Kochi Corporation as Kerala local body poll looms large
content: UDF alleges Kochi Corporation has come under the scanner of VACB during the five-year term of LDF govt. LDF, however, dismisses allegation as baseless

title: Karnataka government relieves Bidar hostel cook for participating in RSS route march
content: The action follows a complaint received by the District Backward Classes Welfare Officer via WhatsApp on October 20, 2025, regarding Pramod Kumar's participation in the march.

title: Odisha Police arrest 12 persons in murder case of State Bar Council member Pitabas Panda
content: Former MLA, former mayor and sitting corporator have been arrested for plotting the killing, as police say they thought the deceased would have hampered their political growth

title: IT Ministry proposes strict rules for labelling deepfakes amid¬†AI¬†misuse
content: The proposed rules mandate social media companies to require their users to declare if they are uploading deepfake content

title: NDA seat-sharing deal in Bihar: How many seats each party is contesting?
content: Nitish Kumar‚Äôs JD(U) party has mostly contested more seats than the BJP, but the 2025 seat deal is a move towards parity within the alliance.

title: Telangana CM sets two year deadline for completion of OGH new complex
content: Planning for the new complex should encompass its connectivity from different parts of the city, says the Chief Minister

title: Kerala govt to dissolve State Level Monitoring Committee on solid waste management
content: Decision is based on government‚Äôs inference that robust institutional frameworks are already operational in Kerala

title: Will take up issues related to paddy procurement with T.N. govt.: Palaniswami tells farmers
content: Food Minister R. Sakkarapani, however, denied the Leader of Opposition‚Äôs statements pertaining to the paddy procurement process

title: Protests by Valmiki Samaj against former MP Ramesh Katti‚Äôs alleged abusive statement in Karnataka
content: The complaint states that while talking to his supporters after the polling was over, Ramesh Katti used obscene words against the entire Valmiki community while trying to criticise the Jarkiholi brothers

title: Ex-Punjab DGP denies role in son's death, says SIT probe to reveal truth
content: Former Punjab Police chief Mohammad Mustafa denies involvement in his son Aqil Akhter‚Äôs death, asserting a probe will clarify the situation after allegations of drug overdose and family conflict emerges

title: Kerala to be declared free from extreme poverty on November 1
content: CM Pinarayi Vijayan to declare Kerala free from extreme poverty at a function in Thiruvananthapuram. Actors Mohanlal, Mammootty, and Kamal Haasan will be special guests

title: Textile showroom‚Äôs warehouse catches fire in Coimbatore
content: The fire was reported at Maha Sree Laxmi Silks on Oppanakara Street, one of the busiest shopping areas in the city

title: Haryana worst hit by post-Deepavali air pollution as 10 cities from State among India‚Äôs 16 most polluted
content: Jind, around 130 km north-west of Delhi, fared the worst on CPCB‚Äôs daily Air Quality Index (AQI) for October 21

title: IMD issues red alert for six districts in Andhra Pradesh
content: The IMD also issued an orange alert for the districts of Kurnool, Nandyal, Anantapur, Sri Sathya Sai and Bapatla for October 22

title: Torrential rains lash Tamil Nadu as Northeast monsoon intensifies
content: The floodgates of Chennai‚Äôs two reservoirs have been opened wider. Red alert for Ranipet, Tiruvallur districts and orange alert for many north Tamil Nadu districts including Chennai, till 8.30 a.m. on October 23

title: Tejashwi Yadav promises to make contractual employers permanent in Bihar
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav says there are no disputes within the Opposition alliance, Mahagathbandhan, and all questions will be settled by Thursday (October 23, 2025)

title: Supreme Court Collegium‚Äôs shift in Justice Sreedharan‚Äôs appointment raises concerns over Executive influence in judicial independence
content: Supreme Court Collegium‚Äôs reversal on Justice Atul Sreedharan‚Äôs transfer amid government requests raises concerns over judicial independence and political interference in appointments

title: Undertrial prisoner escapes from sub-jail in Odisha
content: ‚ÄúA prisoner escaped from the sub-jail by jumping over the prison wall with the help of a blanket,‚Äù say police

title: Jubilee Hills byelection turns protest ground for several sections
content: Pensioners who have not received their retirement benefits, people set to lose their properties to RRR project, those opposing Pharma City project and unemployed youth are among the protestors who filed nominations

title: Indian embassy in Kabul will help ‚Äòregional peace‚Äô: Taliban spokesperson Suhail Shaheen
content: It is a rightful step to put bilateral relations on normal track, build trust, promote trade and cooperation and play a constructive role in¬†regional peace,‚Äù says

title: Scheduled Caste man thrashed, forced to drink urine in Madhya Pradesh; three arrested
content: ‚ÄúThree persons abducted the victim from Gwalior and brought him to Bhind in a vehicle, where he was beaten up and forced to drink urine,‚Äù says Additional Superintendent of Police

title: Siddaramaiah government resorting to misinformation campaign in Karnataka unable to digest GST reforms: Capt. Brijesh Chowta
content: While Karnataka‚Äôs representatives had endorsed the reforms at GST Council, Siddaraimah‚Äôs attack follows political insecurity, the MP alleges

title: Helicopter carrying President Droupadi Murmu gets stuck on helipad during Sabarimala visit
content: Chopper made a safe touchdown at newly prepared helipad around 9.05 a.m., but its tyres sank slightly into freshly laid concrete soon after President disembarked. President, however, continued her journey to Pampa by road without any delay

title: While Modi conceals, Trump reveals: Congress after U.S. President repeats Russian oil claims
content: The PM has finally acknowledged publicly that President Trump called him up and that the two spoke to each other, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Two cases of corporal punishment faced by nine-year-olds belatedly come to light in Karnataka
content: Teacher of a residential school in Chitradurga was arrested on Tuesday for brutally assaulting a nine-year-old for calling home

title: PM Modi thanks Trump for Deepavali wishes, silent on tariffs
content: On this festival of lights, may our two great democracies continue to illuminate the world with hope and stand united against terrorism in all its forms, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Monsoon rains LIVE: IMD withdraws red alert in Kerala; rains lash several parts of Tamil Nadu
content: IMD withdraws red alert for Idukki, Palakkad, and Malappuram districts on Wednesday (October 22, 2025) and placed the three districts on an orange alert; a red alert has been issued for six districts in Andhra Pradesh

title: On CBI takeovers: a judicial standpoint
content: The Supreme Court has transferred the investigation into the Karur stampede from an SIT to the CBI. However, the top court‚Äôs reasoning, entirely based on petitioners‚Äô pleadings, unaccompanied by prima facie evidence, is simply not enough to shift a case to the CBI

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Mahagatbandhan fields 253 candidates for 243 seats
content: In five seats ‚Äî Vaishali, Narkatiaganj, Sikandara, Kahalgaon, and Sultanganj ‚Äî the Congress and the RJD candidates are facing off against each other.

title: White topping DPR being prepared for 500-km Bengaluru roads: D.K. Shivakumar
content: Speaking after inaugurating the white topping and comprehensive road development work in the Gandhinagar Assembly Constituency, he said the city has 1,650 km of major roads, with white topping currently being done on 104 km of new roads

title: Mangling Chennai‚Äôs street names and distorting history
content: Rajachar¬†Street¬†in T. Nagar is spelt in three different ways¬†on¬†the signboards of the Chennai Corporation. The street is named after S.N.V.¬†Rajachar who served as the Chief Presidency Magistrate in Madras.

title: How Janaki Ramachandran became the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu after MGR‚Äôs demise
content: Her regime lasted only 24 days until the dismissal of the AIADMK government in January 1988, after which she quit politics a year later.

title: How a rattled Jayalalithaa tackled Vijayakant‚Äôs political reach
content: In 2011, Jayalalithaa tied up with Vijayakant‚Äôs DMDK to take on the ruling DMK.  However, in February 2012, the AIADMK leader snapped relations with the DMDK following a showdown with Vijayakant in the Assembly.

title: WB BJP leadership alleges that Trinamool Govt is delaying Census in the State for political reasons
content: The BJP leadership in West Bengal has also alleged that fake birth and death certificates being issued from a state run hospital in Kharibari, an area bordering Bangladesh in North Bengal.

title: Activists urge to reschedule, reroute Goddess Kali immersion procession for communal harmony in Cuttack

title: Fire, burn emergencies go up during¬†Deepavali¬†across Tamil Nadu
content: The 108 emergency management service handled 7,463 cases,¬†compared with an average of 5,051 cases on a normal day. Assaults went up to 808, vehicular trauma emergencies tripled

title: Kochi Corporation shares State govt‚Äôs development and welfare-oriented vision, says CM
content: Chief Minister highlights Kochi Corporation‚Äôs development initiatives; says the govt. is undertaking several projects for the comprehensive development of the city

title: High Court notice on plea for Ajmer dargah panel, challenge to CCTV cameras

title: Gang of four arrested for looting shop
content: Following a theft case, the Sadashivanagar police arrested a gang of four for allegedly stealing cash and valuables from a shop

title: Deepavali fireworks worsen Delhi‚Äôs air quality
content: 16 cities record ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô air quality; pollution readings point to violation of SC norms on use of green firecrackers; Dharuhera in Haryana records worst air quality nationally

title: Mahagatbandhan fields 253 candidates for 243 seats in Bihar
content: Congress candidates face off against the RJD in five seats and against the CPI in another four; fingers are being pointed at the RJD for stretching the negotiations down to the wire

title: T.N. government must expedite paddy procurement, says Anbumani
content: In a statement, he said around 70% of the 6.13 lakh acres of paddy fields was harvested but only 40% of the harvest had been procured so far

title: Tamil Nadu government reiterates purchase preference for SC/ST-owned firms while floating tenders
content: The State government had enabled the mandatory purchase preference for enterprises owned by entrepreneurs from SC and ST communities under certain provisions of the Tamil Nadu Transparency in Tenders Act, 1998, and Rules, 2000

title: U.P. CM announces age relaxation, reservation for Agniveers in police
content: Agniveers retiring in 2026 and beyond will receive an age relaxation and horizontal reservation, on par with ex-servicemen, in direct recruitment to the ranks of Constable, Mounted Constable, and Fireman

title: Nitish sparks row on first day of his campaign as he rebukes Sanjay Jha
content: Mr. Jha was trying to prevent the Bihar CM from garlanding BJP candidate Rama Nishad; RJD mocks Mr. Kumar‚Äôs actions; Opposition VIP candidate‚Äôs nomination rejected in Sugauli constituency

title: Foreign carriers ‚Äòpoaching‚Äô Indian pilots would be disturbing: Elbers
